intro: Hypericum vulcanicum var. matsumurae, commonly known as the Matsumura's St. John's wort, is a rare and endemic species native to Japan. It is a shrub characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features include small, five-petaled flowers with prominent stamens, and it belongs to the family Hypericaceae. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
